comment: I enjoyed this class very much, so I don't understand why she has such a bad rating. She actually teaches and uses both real-life and textbook examples during lectures. The reflections you had to be in class to receive credit mainly guess speakers 100% had reflections, but everything else was online. She was by far the best professor I ever had.

Doesn't grade everyone equally. Me and my classmate had the same amount of absences but got different grades for it. Send her emails and never replied to any, and assignments don't have clear instructions.
Don't take this class if you care about your GPA. Tough grader and doesn't give feedback about it, not clear about instructions, and doesn't reply to emails.

I would choose a different professor. Grading criteria is not exactly clear despite what is on the syllabus. Flow of class is unorganized. Busy work that does not help with exams. Harsh grader. Does not always reply to emails. Projects on top of exams and online work that takes hours to complete. Never been so compelled to write a bad-ish review.

Genuinely enjoyed this class; the class wasn't difficult imo, 4 tests, connect assignments each month, 10 reflections, & 2 group projects. I will say her grading is strange & me and other students noticed we were not graded the same or lost points for things other students didn't. Must attend class for the reflections, but it's not a boring class.
She was very condescending to me & my groupmates when I took her Spring '24. I've never had a professor randomly one day just decide to pick on her students.

I don't really recommend this professor for a first-level marketing class. She moved from teaching grad students and it really shows in how she teaches. Felt like we were supposed to know everything already. I attended most classes and they didn't reflect what was on the exams. To be fair she graded generously and was very entertaining in class.
rating_tags: Group projects--Clear grading criteria--Lots of homework

comment: Her lectures were interesting and she applied real-world issues to what we were learning, which made it easier to understand. With that being said, as a non-marketing major, I suggest taking another intro level marketing class if you are looking for something more easier. She had A LOT of busy work. She was very rude and condescending too!

Gala's class was an interesting one to take to say the least. She does not know current trends or trendy brands unless ones expressed in the news. She also went from teaching a masters classes to teaching undergrad then ask why we do not already know this.  All test on lockdown with webcam. Hardest class I have ever taken as a Kennesaw Student.

The professor is very knowledgeable and offers great real-world examples during class, however there is a lot of busy work that does not translate well against graded assignments (quizzes and tests). Professor talks at individuals in a condescending tone often. Be aware.
Professor Gala was a pretty good professor! She seemed new to operating D2L and took a while to grade things sometimes, but as long as you tried your hardest, she will give you a good grade.
I has taken this class as a summer and there were way too many difficult assignments to keep up with in just 8 weeks. I would definitely recommend taking this class in a fall/spring semester.
Very easy for 4820 but 3150 was a different story. Tests were very hard and not that much related to the powerpoints. Lots of assignments beware.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Participation matters

comment: I am usually a straight A student but I struggled to achieve a C in this class. A lot of work for an 8 week summer class.

This review is for MKTG 4650 Advertising (online)

In total, you could spend almost up to 100 hours for a semester's worth of work for this 3 credit hour class when most of this work is just BUSY WORK. Not learning anything either. I have never had so much work for an online class before taking this class. STAY AWAY!

Professor Gala was great! She is so knowledgeable and fosters great in-class discussions. It was a great learning environment. Make sure to do your homework and reflections a few days before the due date - they take a while. Group field studies are super easy. Tests are basically just the homework quizzes. Take her!

There are 4 tests that are lockdown without camera. You will have to do 2 field studies in a group. There are many quizzes, but they are very easy. Do not try to email her, because she will never respond. Overall, the class has a lot of busy work but is pretty easy. I appreciate how she has a lot of real-world experience.

Prof Gala had a LOT of assignments. She also did not grade things in a timely fashion or reply to emails. She was a super easy grader and all assignments were open-book. There were 28 (!!!) case studies, and I probably only did 20 or so and still made an A. I recommend her because of how easy of a grader she was, but there are a lot of assignments.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--So many papers--Test heavy

comment: This is an easy course but be prepared to read. No group project which is great. Prof. Gala DOES NOT round grades and it can be a little frustrating when you have a 89.99. Also, there are only about 4 due dates throughout the semester and very easy to get behind if you do not follow her "suggested" completion dates.
Great teacher. Good communication, good material, easy to meet due dates.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Accessible outside class--Online Savvy

comment: This class was not hard at all. Lots of assignments that were due, but just follow the syllabus and you will get them all done on time. The quizzes and exams I found to be easy just because of other classes that I have taken in the past, and the other assignments are not hard either. The case studies and video questions take a lot of time just FYI.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Clear grading criteria--Accessible outside class

comment: Graded by one LinkedIn assignment, case studies, Connect assignments, quizzes, and four tests. There's a lockdown browser on everything but no camera. Straightforward syllabus and she does a great job of sending reminders regarding what's due. You don't hear from professor much but she's very kind. Replies to emails and answers all questions.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--Participation matters

comment: I took this class online. There were a lot of assignments, but that is expected for a summer course. The material was interesting, but there were a lot of concepts and definitions to know. Graded on Connect assignments, case studies, tests, LinkedIn assignments, and an end-of-semester project. Definitely recommend taking her for this class.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Accessible outside class--Clear grading criteria
